country_overview.content: Iceland, known for its stunning natural beauty, is a Nordic island nation located in the North Atlantic. Famous for its dramatic landscapes featuring volcanoes, geysers, hot springs, and lava fields, Iceland attracts travelers from around the world. Reykjavik, the capital, runs on geothermal power and is home to the National and Saga museums, tracing Iceland’s Viking history. As a member of the Schengen Area, Iceland follows the Schengen visa policy, allowing travelers to enter the country on a Schengen visa if they meet the necessary requirements.

tourist_visa.title: Tourist Visa (Schengen Visa)
tourist_visa.description: The Schengen Tourist Visa allows individuals to visit Iceland and other Schengen countries for tourism purposes. This visa is valid for up to 90 days within a 180-day period. It is a short-stay visa that can be single, double, or multiple-entry.

business_visa.title: Business Visa (Schengen Visa)
business_visa.description: The Schengen Business Visa permits individuals to travel to Iceland for business-related activities such as meetings, conferences, or negotiations. Like the Tourist Visa, it is valid for up to 90 days within a 180-day period.

student_visa.title: Student Visa (Residence Permit for Study)
student_visa.description: The Student Visa is for non-EU/EEA nationals who wish to study in Iceland for more than 90 days. Applicants must be enrolled in a recognized Icelandic educational institution. A residence permit for study is required for long-term stays.

work_visa.title: Work Visa (Residence Permit for Employment)
work_visa.description: The Work Visa is required for non-EU/EEA nationals who have secured employment in Iceland. Applicants must obtain a residence permit for employment, which allows them to live and work in Iceland for an extended period.

tourist_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must demonstrate their intent to visit Iceland for tourism purposes and have a valid passport, travel insurance, and sufficient funds.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least three months of validity after planned departure from the Schengen Area
Proof of accommodation (hotel bookings or invitation letter)
Travel itinerary and return flight tickets
additional_documents: Proof of civil status (marriage certificate, birth certificate, etc.)
Letter of invitation from an Icelandic host (if applicable)

business_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must be involved in business activities in Iceland and must provide an invitation from an Icelandic company.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least three months of validity after planned departure from the Schengen Area
Invitation letter from an Icelandic company
Proof of business activities (conference registration, meeting details)
Proof of accommodation and return flight tickets
additional_documents: Proof of previous business dealings (if applicable)

student_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have been accepted by an Icelandic educational institution and provide proof of enrollment and financial capacity.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least three months of validity after planned departure from the Schengen Area
Letter of acceptance from an Icelandic educational institution

work_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have a job offer from an Icelandic employer and meet the necessary qualifications. A residence permit for employment is required.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least three months of validity after planned departure from the Schengen Area
Job offer letter or employment contract
Work permit issued by the Icelandic government

step_1.title: Determine Visa Type
step_1.description: Identify the appropriate visa type based on your purpose of visit to Iceland. Ensure you meet the eligibility requirements for the selected visa category.

step_2.title: Check Eligibility
step_2.description: Review the specific eligibility requirements for the visa type you are applying for, including health, character, and financial requirements.

step_3.title: Gather Required Documents
step_3.description: Collect all necessary documents including the visa application form, passport, photographs, and supporting documents relevant to your visa type.

step_4.title: Complete the Application Form
step_4.description: Fill out the visa application form accurately. Submit your application online or at an Icelandic embassy or consulate.

step_5.title: Submit the Application
step_5.description: Submit your completed application form along with the required documents to the Icelandic embassy, consulate, or visa application center. An appointment may be required for submission.

step_6.title: Attend an Interview (if required)
step_6.description: For some visa types, you may be required to attend an interview at the Icelandic embassy or consulate. Prepare to answer questions about your travel purpose and background.

step_7.title: Wait for Processing
step_7.description: Visa processing times vary depending on the type of visa and your nationality. Standard processing typically takes 15-20 calendar days.

step_8.title: Receive the Visa
step_8.description: Once your visa is approved, you will be notified to collect it from the embassy, consulate, or visa application center. Ensure that all details on the visa are correct before traveling.

visa_fees.content: Visa fees for Schengen visas vary depending on the type of visa and applicant's nationality. Fees are payable at the time of application and are non-refundable.

processing_time.content: The standard processing time for Icelandic visas is 15-20 calendar days. Processing times may vary based on the type of visa and your nationality.

visa_validity.content: The validity of Icelandic visas varies by type. Schengen visas are generally valid for up to 90 days within a 180-day period, with single, double, or multiple entries.

entry_requirements.content: Upon arrival in Iceland, travelers must present their valid visa, passport, and may be required to provide additional documentation such as proof of accommodation and sufficient funds.

faq_1.question: Can I extend my visa while in Iceland?
faq_1.answer: Visa extensions for Schengen visas are generally not allowed unless there are exceptional circumstances. Contact Icelandic immigration authorities for more details.

faq_2.question: Is a visa required before arrival in Iceland?
faq_2.answer: Yes, most travelers need to obtain a Schengen visa before entering Iceland, unless they are from a visa-exempt country.

faq_3.question: Can I work in Iceland on a Tourist Visa?
faq_3.answer: No, working on a Tourist Visa is not allowed. If you intend to work in Iceland, you must apply for a Work Visa and obtain a residence permit.
